Posts.Content: I am going to be having herceptin for a year by injection after I have had chemo I was told I may be able to have a pic line which I will go for if at all possible. Will have to ask chemo nurse.
Posts.Title: Herceptin by injection

Posts.Content: Dreamthief forget the cadburys cream eggs. No one in my house likes them. Rest sounds ok though.
Posts.Title: pain running down inside of arm

Posts.Content: I would say sounds like cording ( I get it a lot) but still check it out. Better to be safe than sorry and it will put your mind at rest. Dream thief I like your definition of chemo names what does FEC-T stand for.
Posts.Title: pain running down inside of arm

Posts.Content: I am nowhere near the end of my treatment, but I would guess it is normal to have weird feelings at the end ( or start) of anything major in life. I remember feeling weird the last time I left my school gates as I finished my last exam, and leaving my home ( several times) as I moved house. Take time to relax and enjoy the summer months.
Posts.Title: All my treatment nearly finished, weird feeling.

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy and lymph node removal on right side on 14th march ( my oldest daughters 14th birthday) I am still in some pain and forced to rest a lot as I still get exhausted very quickly. I am waiting to start chemotherapy to be followed by radiotherapy and 5 years minimum of daily hormone tablets. Rest when you are tired if you have kids or partner insist they help with housework , the less stress you have and the less work you do the quicker your recovery will be. Carry on with the exercises you have been given. But don't overdo them you will suffer for it if you do, but do what you can every day. Take care and rest your body needs it.
Posts.Title: 2 weeks on. Still just as sore

Posts.Content: The question is not as daft as you may think it sounds. I will be having a mastectomy soon. ( seeing consultant next week to discuss when etc). My question is probably more daft. What is a mastectomy bra I have never heard of them.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bra - daft question

Posts.Content: Thanks dreamthief I will be having mastectomy soon. I was wondering how I would stop the 'falsie' falling out.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bra - daft question

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy and all lymph nodes removed last March,(on my daughters 17th birthday). Movement in my arm was quite restricted for some time, but, the excersizes I was given helped me to regain movement, I now have full movement but still some cording, but this could well be because I didn't do the exercizes as much as I should have done or for as long as I should have done. I have been fortunate in that as yet I have not had lymphodema. you just need to take extra care not to get cut. We have several pets and I refuse to feed the ferrets or gerbils to avoid the risk of getting bitten or scratched. If i need to clean the cat litter I use extra care of wearing disposable gloves.  If you have any concerns talk to your breast care and/or surgeon, they should be able to reassure you.  The inconvienience of temporary restricted movement is a small price to pay to know that the cancer has been removed.
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Katie17 I had full node removal a year ago along with mastectomy. I couldn't have radiotherapy ( which they were originally going to give me) because I was then diagnosed with another condition where radiotherapy is thought to increase the risk of tumours forming.
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: I found my lump 11th jan biopsy mammogram ect 4th February, diagnosed 14th feb had surgery 14th march now 6th April and don't know yet when my chemo will start. Once I have had chemo I need radiotherapy and then several years of hormone tablets ( surgery was mastectomy and lymph node removal. 8 out of 30 were affected) think they have to wait till you are fully recovered from op. Before starting chemo. Waiting is hard. I had grade3 high risk tumor and waiting is worrying but I guess they know what they are doing.
Posts.Title: diagnosis to chemo starting...worried

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with breast cancer 14th February I have had mastectomy am waiting for chemo then radiotherapy and 5 years plus of herceptin. ( that's the current plan) I have had extream tiredness for a long time and still have it every day . If I go out or just two hours I am exhausted for the rest of the day. I can only o very little in the house at a time before I need to rest. I guess it is something the cancer itself and the treatment causes. All we can do is rest as much as we can and learn to pace ourselfs and not overdo things.
Posts.Title: So tired
